result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph W Heroff

records.addlTxt: CASES: 20CF264 & 22CF4. 11:26 am. Defendant Joseph W Heroff in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Joseph W Heroff. Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for the State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. Burger-requesting cont of JT for next week. Kemp-analyst is not available. CT will grant request for continuance of JT.  20CF264-JA to reschedule 2 day JT w/ analyst/parties, PTC in advance. 22CF4 to track. Bonds cont. 11:29 am adj.
Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.

CASES 20CF264, 22CF04. 10:28 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Joseph W Heroff in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Joseph W Heroff.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests continuance of JT. CT - denied. 10:38 am adj.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.

CASES: 20CF264 & 22CF4. 9:48 AM Defendant Joseph W Heroff in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Joseph W Heroff.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk.
JA to set 20CF264 for 2 day JT w/ analyst/counsel, 22CF4 to track.  PTC to be set in advance.  Bonds cont.  9:50 am adj.
Case Reassignment Order- Br 1 to Br 2

CASES 20CF264, 22CF4. 02:29 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Joseph W Heroff in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Holly D. Wood Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
20CF264 - PH: Def waives PH. CT accepts waiver. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Reading waived, plea NG. 
22CF4 - ARGN: Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Reading waived, plea NG. Bond cont. JA to schedule next hearing. Bond cont. 2:33 pm adj.

records.addlTxt: $500.00 PREVIOUSLY POSTED. COVERS CASES 22CF04 & 20CF264.  No controlled substances without a prescription.  Not to possess drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Joseph W Heroff in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:40 p.m. AO-Clerk. Atty Burger - de has rec'd CC, waive reading, qualifies. State requests sig bond. Ct sets bond.  Per Atty Burger - de waives PH. Ct accepts waiver, de bound over. 2:44 p.m. adj.  Arraignment scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
